üìö A Lifelong Curiosity for Philosophy

Since childhood, I‚Äôve been fascinated by philosophy as a way of thinking and perceiving the world. I was first drawn to Wang Yangming's school of thought in middle school and deeply resonated with the idea of unity between knowing and doing. In university, I explored Western and modern philosophy through electives, gaining a more structured understanding of epistemology, ethics, and existentialism. Philosophy continues to shape how I think and live.

Meditation helps me anchor myself, calm my mind, and observe thoughts with clarity. It‚Äôs an ongoing practice, but one that constantly brings me back to balance.

‚ú® From Curiosity to Exploration

Whether it's data science or philosophy, my pursuit always begins with curiosity. I want to understand the world ‚Äî through tools, through thought, through experience.
